title: Why is my Drafts folder suddenly empty this morning?
creator: wrgarrett45
content:
I opened Thunderbird this morning and my Drafts folder is empty. Not only that but when I am composing an email and hit Save, which is setup to save to Drafts folder, I get a little popup that says Copying message to drafts folder. I open Drafts folder and it is not there. However, this new message that I tried to safe to Drafts shows up in a folder named All Mail. I try to drag it to Drafts but it does not copy or move to Drafts. I created a new folder and named it Drafts 2 then copied this test message to Drafts 2. But where are my original Drafts folder contents> I have changed absolutely nothing in Thunderbird. No settings changes, no nothing. What the heck? I had important things in my Drafts folder and now they are gone.

Oh, this happens on my Primary Gmail account. I open Gmail in my browser, check Drafts and it's empty too.

I check my ISP furnished POP3 account and it has a message in Drafts. I create a new message, save it to drafts in this POP3 account and Thunderbird147 puts it there.

content: Bonjour, j'utilise Thunderbird sur MacBook M3, MacOs Tahoe 26.2, sur Thunderbird j'ai 3 comptes messagerie .bbox et un compte .gmail dans le dossier envoyés de chacun de ces comptes ne figurent QUE les messages envoyés du mois en cours ou du mois précédent si aucun message n'a été envoyé le mois en cours aucuns des messages envoyés auparavant ne s'y trouvent. title: Cannot Insert Image into body of email
creator: gimpeljj
content:
I have a new Windows 11 computer and installed Thunderbird. Whenever I try to insert an image there is no option to do so. I was able to do this on my Windows 10 machine but not on this new Windows 11 machine. I went into settings and in the Composition section, under Sending Format, I did have it set to Automatic but changed it to Only HTML. In the Write message, in the Options menu, there is no insert image or anything. On my Windows 10 machine, there was an Insert for images and tables etc. On my Windows 11 machine, none of those options are available. How can they be missing? I don't want to send my image as an attachment, I want to insert it to the body of the message.

Any ideas as to how I can get the insert options in Thunderbird?

Thanks. Jane

title: CalDAV does not update from Server
creator: me547
content:
Hello,

I have two calendars in Thunderbird connected to my email server at the provider https://all-inkl.com/. The connection is done via CalDAV.

My problem is that the calendars do not synchronize with the changes on the server or do it in intervals that are not understandable to me. I have also connected the server via CalDAV to my calendar app on my phone and that works fine. Changes to events on my phone are synchronized to the server quickly and I can check the server to see them. However in Thunderbird, the changes do not arrive and even if I manually tell the calendars to synchronize, nothing happens. The only reliable way I have managed to make them update is closing Thunderbird and reopening it. Then the synchronization happens by itself within a minute.

Does anyone know how to address this problem?

Switching offline support on or off makes no difference, as far as I can tell by testing.


My system: Thunderbird 147.0.2 (64-bit) on Windows 11 Calendar settings: - refresh calendar: every 5 minutes - read only: off - show reminders: on - offline support: on


Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:147.0.2 (64-bit);os:Windows 11

content: I opened Thunderbird and it seems that all my emails from Inbox are gone. They weren't moved to Trash, they were just gone. My folders are intact and also my Sent emails are still there. If I go to Troubleshooting Information -> Profile Folder -> Inbox and open in Notepad they are still there, however the extent of my IT knowledge ends here. What could be the issue and how can I restore my Inbox?
